comments:
Fresh install of Eclipse reports "Problems Opening Page" and hangs.

Details dialog contains following information:
XPCOM error -2147467262

Previous versions (3.0) and tried milestones (at least M5) worked fine.

Very strange error.  What version of mozilla do you have installed?  Are there
any crash logs or anything like that?

I have installed Mozilla 1.7.8, Firefox 1.0.4 and yesterday I've updated it to
1.0.5.
Some more infromation: I've created additional workspace for experiments and
when I choosed that workspace in startup dialog Eclipse 3.1 started without
problems. But when I tried to choose empty workspace or let Eclipse create new
workspace it failed with reported error. 

I suspect that problem is caused by the code which creates new workspace. Seems
it forgets to copy some files (intro?) into new workspace and this causes a failure.

When you start eclipse on a new workspace, it will open the Welcome view,
which is an embedded mozilla browser.  You can probably work around
this by disabling mozilla embedding, try:

  export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/nowhere

What distribution are you using?  Can you think of anything special about
your install of mozilla?

A workaround does help. 
I'm using SuSE 9.1. Mozilla installed in its regular location for this
distribution. Firefox is installed in my home directory.

Mozilla is probably in /usr/lib/mozilla, is that correct?  Can you export
MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME to be /usr/lib/mozilla and ensure that this version is the one
which is crashing Eclipse?

After a number of experiments I've found that problem caused by the Mozilla
1.8a2. Replacing it with 1.7.8 resolved the issue.
Was that version shipped by SuSE or had you installed it yourself?
SuSE is shipped with much older version, this one I've installed manually.

Exactly the same issue with Suse Professionnal 9.2 for me.
After a delete of the directory .eclipse, Eclipse restarts correctly.

(In reply to comment #9)
> Exactly the same issue with Suse Professionnal 9.2 for me.
> After a delete of the directory .eclipse, Eclipse restarts correctly.

Hi,

I have this problem on Windows XP. Does anyone have a solution ? the exact
problem is when I launch Eclipse 3.1.1 with some plugins (SAP, C/C++, etc...),
it tries to load "eclipse.team.core" and says : "Problems Opening Page". When I
look for more details : "org/eclipse/help/ui/internal/browser/win32/WebBrowser"

I'm using Firefox 1.0.7

Thanks for your help.

I'm running SUSE 10.1 beta 6.  Interestingly, no "mozilla" is available as a standard package, only xulrunner (1.8).  

When trying to use
MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME="/usr/lib/xulrunner-1.8.0.1"
I receive an org.eclipse.swt.SWTError with 
XPCOM error -2147467262

That's fine, XulRunner is supposed to be a drop-in backwards-compatible
replacement for mozilla embedding clients.  You shouldn't need to
manually set MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME either, SuSE should be installing a
gre.conf file.
afaik suse is installing an /etc/gre.d/*.conf file as implemented by xulrunner -register-global

In reply to #13, yes SuSE 10.1-beta6 does not have a "gre.conf", but it does have /etc/gre.d/1.8.0.1_2006022300.conf containing:

[1.8.0.1_2006022300]
GRE_PATH=/usr/lib/xulrunner-1.8.0.1
xulrunner=true
javaxpcom=1

I am still getting that "no interface" error code if I have MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME set to the xulrunner directory, and add that directory to the start of LD_LIBRARY_PATH.  It's a drop in replacement for mozilla for embedding?  If it should be working, I'll open a distinct bug on this here and on the suse site.

I'm having the same problem with a recent Ubuntu Dapper beta.
I have firefox 1.5.0.1. The workaround given in #3 works. 
The stack trace is not exactly the same, as in my case eclipse tries to use the browser for displaying a Javadoc hover.
Is there something I can do to help?

In reviewing the comments, I believe that most are running with relatively new mozillas/firefoxes/xulrunners, in which querying for nsIDocShell that has LoadStream will fail.  This is definitely the cause of the error described in comment 15 (and I believe in comment 0 as well, though there is not enough of a trace provided to be sure), and is fixed in recent eclipse versions, see bug 133304.

So I'm marking this report as a duplicate of bug 133304.  To everyone here:
-> please reopen this report if you are using eclipse build 3.2RC1 or newer and still see the "XPCOM error -2147467262"
-> please open a new bug report if you see a Browser crash of any other kind


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 133304 ***
